meanings.sent1: The lemonade was spritzier than the orange juice.
meanings.sent2: The sparkling water was much spritzier than the still water.
meanings.sent3: The party became even spritzier when the music started playing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as spritzier as a burst of bubbles.
meanings.sent5: The fresh mint added a spritzier flavor to the cocktail.

meanings.definition: Having a lively or effervescent quality
meanings.sent1: The children's laughter made the atmosphere spritzier.
meanings.sent2: The champagne had a spritzier taste compared to the wine.
meanings.sent3: The joke had a spritzier effect on the audience than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was as spritzier as a bottle of soda shaken too much.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks made the night sky look even spritzier.

meanings.definition: To make something more lively or effervescent
meanings.sent1: She spritziered the drink by adding some soda.
meanings.sent2: The music spritziered the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: He spritziered up the conversation with a joke.
meanings.sent4: The bubbles spritziered the bath water.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling lights spritziered the stage performance.
